item.title: Ready or not, age verification is rolling out across the internet
item.description: On July 25th, the UK became one of the first countries to widely implement age verification. Its Online Safety Act requires sites hosting porn and other content deemed “harmful” - including Reddit, Di

item.title: Will online safety laws become the next tariff bargaining chip?
item.description: President Donald Trump and other Republicans have railed for years against foreign regulation of US tech companies, including online safety laws. As the US fights a global tariff war, it may bring tho

item.title: DOJ paves the way for a legal war on fact-checking
item.description: Newspapers and social media platforms that agree to deprioritize misinformation could be violating US antitrust law if they exclude rivals or lead to anticompetitive effects, the Justice Department sa
